summary: This is an email chain from May 17, 2019, between an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York and an FBI Special Supervisory Agent (SSA) from Squad C-20 (VCAC/Human Trafficking) in New York. The AUSA is coordinating with the FBI agent to discuss providing examples of past cases where their office has used a vendor for document scanning, cataloguing, and indexing, related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney working on the Epstein investigation
persons.context: The AUSA from the Southern District of New York is emailing an FBI SSA to coordinate a call about providing examples of past cases involving document management vendors for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.role: Special Supervisory Agent, Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking
persons.context: The FBI SSA from the VCAC/Human Trafficking squad in New York is corresponding with an AUSA to schedule a call regarding document management for the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: The AUSA and the FBI SSA are coordinating on the logistical aspects of document management for the Epstein investigation, as evidenced by their email exchange to schedule a call.

events.title: Scheduled call about Epstein investigation documents
events.description: The AUSA and FBI SSA plan to have a phone call to discuss examples of past cases where the U.S. Attorney's office used a vendor for document scanning, cataloguing, and indexing, specifically for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated May 17, 2019, showing coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and the FBI's VCAC/Human Trafficking squad on the Epstein investigation.
The primary discussion point is logistical: obtaining examples of past cases where the U.S. Attorney's office used an external vendor for document scanning, cataloguing, and indexing.
The correspondence indicates an active phase of evidence management and processing in the Epstein investigation as of May 2019.
The FBI agent involved is from Squad C-20, which handles Violent Crimes Against Children (VCAC) and Human Trafficking cases.
